emptyState.title: How can I help you?
emptyState.subtitle: Ask me questions about food, diet, or nutrition

suggestions: What should I eat for sugar allergy?

onboarding.slide1Desc: Get personalized food analysis and recommendations aligned with your goals.
onboarding.slide2Desc: Guru is not medical advice. Always consult a doctor before making health decisions.

guru.fixedWarning: Guru may make mistakes. Not medical advice. Consult a doctor.

facts: An apple can help you wake up better than coffee.
Honey never spoils. 3000-year-old honey was found in Egyptian pyramids.
Strawberries are not berries, they belong to the rose family.
Potatoes can absorb and reflect WiFi signals.
Chocolate was used as currency by ancient Maya and Aztec civilizations.
Tomatoes are botanically fruits but legally classified as vegetables.
Bananas are slightly radioactive due to potassium.
Carrots were originally purple. Orange carrots were developed by the Dutch in the 17th century.
Coconut water can be used as blood plasma in emergencies.
Watermelon is 92% water.
Oranges contain less vitamin C than apples.
Vanilla is the only edible fruit from the orchid family.
Avocado is actually a fruit, technically a berry.
Peanuts grow underground, not on trees.
Coffee beans are actually seeds of a fruit.
Broccoli is actually an edible flower.
It takes 2-3 years for a pineapple to ripen.
Lemons contain more sugar than strawberries.
Honey is a natural antibiotic that kills bacteria.
Garlic is actually a vegetable from the onion family.
Mango is the world's most consumed fruit.
Potato was the first vegetable grown in space in 1995.
An avocado contains more potassium than a banana.
Cherries and peaches are fruits from the rose family.
Mustard seed is one of the world's oldest spices.
Most wasabi is actually dyed horseradish. Real wasabi is very expensive.
A kiwi contains twice as much vitamin C as an orange.
Ginger has been used as medicine for over 5000 years.
Eggplant is technically a fruit.
Cabbage is 91% water.
China produces 80% of the world's garlic.
Cinnamon is actually tree bark.
Black pepper was known as 'black gold' in ancient times.
Mint has over 600 varieties worldwide.
Turmeric is a powerful spice with anti-inflammatory properties.
A cup of broccoli contains more calcium than a glass of milk.
Spinach becomes more nutritious when cooked.
The reason you cry when cutting onions is sulfenic acid.
Chocolate can be toxic to dogs.
Blueberries are one of the richest fruits in antioxidants.
Grapefruit can interact with certain medications.
Artichoke is actually a thistle.
The change in urine smell after eating asparagus is genetic.
Radishes can be harvested in just 3 weeks.
Saffron is the world's most expensive spice, over $10,000 per kilogram.
An apple eaten in the morning provides energy, while eaten at night helps sleep.
Walnuts resemble the brain and are beneficial for brain health.
Chewing celery burns more calories than it contains.
Pasta came to Italy from China.
Capsaicin in peppers creates a burning sensation but doesn't damage tissue.
Green, yellow, and red peppers are the same vegetable at different stages of ripeness.
Dates are a natural energy source and rich in potassium.
Olives are drupes, not regular fruits.
Rice is the staple food for more than half of the world's population.
Eggshells are porous and can absorb odors.
Bee pollen is one of nature's most nutritious foods.
Dark chocolate can help lower blood pressure.
Garlic should be consumed for heart health, not vampire protection.
Pumpkin seeds are rich in zinc.
Kefir is richer in probiotics than yogurt.
Wheat has been cultivated for over 10,000 years.
Walnut oil is very rich in Omega-3 fatty acids.
Almonds are actually seeds from the peach family.
Coconut can technically be a fruit, seed, and nut.
Lentils are one of the oldest cultivated crops.
Chicken egg color depends on the chicken's feather color.
Salmon's pink color comes from the shellfish it eats.
Green tea and black tea come from the same plant, just processed differently.
Cacao beans are bitter before fermentation.
The banana plant is actually a type of herb, not a tree.
Bees visit 4 million flowers to produce one kilogram of honey.
Orange peel contains more vitamin C than the fruit itself.
Red wine contains the antioxidant resveratrol.
Yogurt is a Turkish-origin word used worldwide.
Milk is essentially filtered blood.
Cheese has been made since 8000 BC.
A honey bee produces only 1/12 teaspoon of honey in its lifetime.
India is the world's largest spice producer.
Chickpeas have been consumed by humans for 7500 years.
Soybeans have the most complete amino acid profile among plant protein sources.
waitMessages: Almost there, thanks for your patience...

results.nutrition_data_missing: Nutrition table not readable. Values are estimated based on ingredients.

badges.food_desc: This item is classified as a food product.
badges.notFood_desc: This barcode does not belong to a food product.
badges.eu_banned_desc: Contains additives banned in the European Union.
badges.fda_warn_desc: Contains ingredients with FDA health warnings.
badges.high_protein_desc: Contains a high amount of protein.
badges.sugar_free_desc: Contains no added or natural sugar.
badges.low_fat_desc: Low fat content according to standards.
badges.high_sodium_desc: High salt content, watch for blood pressure risks.
badges.vegetarian_desc: Contains no meat or meat products.
badges.gluten_free_desc: Suitable for those with gluten sensitivity.

findings.high_allergen_desc: {{keyword}} detected. This ingredient is a derivative of {{source}} and is incompatible with your profile.
findings.macro_violation_desc: {{keyword}} detected. May disrupt your {{diet}} diet balance due to potential high carbohydrate or sugar content.
findings.medium_ambiguous_desc: {{keyword}} detected. Since its source (plant/animal) is unspecified, it may carry a {{source}} risk.
findings.medical_ambiguous_desc: {{keyword}} detected. May carry a {{source}} risk (cross-contamination) depending on manufacturing. Check the label.
findings.diet_violation_desc: Contains {{keyword}}, which may not be suitable for {{diet}} diet rules.
findings.safe_summary: Ingredients list seems compatible with your profile.
findings.high_risk_summary: Ingredients derived from {{source}} detected. Consumption not recommended.
findings.medium_risk_summary: Some ingredients might cause sensitivity, please check details.
findings.no_profile_summary: Compatibility analysis cannot be performed because no diet or allergens are defined. Showing general safety score only.
findings.keto_advice_strict: CRITICAL: This amount risks Ketosis state.
findings.keto_advice_moderate: WARNING: Covers a significant part of your daily limit.
findings.lowcarb_advice_high: HIGH: Risky amount for Low Carb diet.
findings.lowcarb_advice_ok: SUITABLE: Can be consumed with portion control.
findings.generic_diet_advice: Should be consumed with caution based on ingredients and nutrition facts.
findings.infant_honey: {{keyword}} detected. Honey poses botulism risk for infants under 1 year.
findings.infant_salt: {{keyword}} detected. Infant kidneys cannot process salt properly.
findings.infant_sugar: {{keyword}} detected. Added sugar is not recommended for infant nutrition.
findings.infant_nut: {{keyword}} detected. Whole nuts pose choking hazard for infants.
findings.infant_cow_milk: {{keyword}} detected. Cow's milk is not suitable for infants under 1 year.
findings.infant_egg_white: {{keyword}} detected. Egg whites may cause allergic reactions under 1 year.
findings.infant_shellfish: {{keyword}} detected. Shellfish poses allergy risk for infants.
findings.infant_caffeine: {{keyword}} detected. Caffeine is not suitable for infants and children.
findings.infant_chocolate: {{keyword}} detected. Chocolate contains caffeine, not suitable for infants.
findings.infant_raw: {{keyword}} detected. Raw foods are not safe for infants.
findings.baby_salt: {{keyword}} detected. Salt intake should be limited for babies 6-12 months.
findings.baby_sugar: {{keyword}} detected. Sugar is not recommended for babies under 1 year.
findings.baby_whole_nut: {{keyword}} detected. Whole nuts pose choking hazard.
findings.baby_peanut_intro: {{keyword}} detected. Nut butters can be introduced carefully with allergy monitoring.
findings.baby_cow_milk: {{keyword}} detected. Recommended as main drink after 1 year.
findings.baby_chocolate: {{keyword}} detected. Should be limited due to caffeine and sugar content.
findings.baby_raw_egg: {{keyword}} detected. Raw or undercooked eggs pose salmonella risk.
findings.baby_raw_fish: {{keyword}} detected. Raw fish is not safe for babies.
findings.baby_processed: {{keyword}} detected. Processed meats contain high salt and additives.
findings.baby_sweetener: {{keyword}} detected. Artificial sweeteners are not recommended for babies.
findings.toddler_choking: {{keyword}} detected. May pose choking hazard for toddlers.
findings.toddler_raw_fish: {{keyword}} detected. Raw fish should be consumed carefully by toddlers.
findings.toddler_sodium: {{keyword}} detected. Salt intake should be monitored for toddlers.
findings.toddler_sweetener: {{keyword}} detected. Artificial sweeteners should be limited for toddlers.
findings.child_caffeine: {{keyword}} detected. Caffeine should be limited for children.
findings.child_energy_drink: {{keyword}} detected. Energy drinks are not suitable for children.
findings.child_alcohol: {{keyword}} detected. Alcohol is absolutely not suitable for children.
findings.child_raw_fish: {{keyword}} detected. Raw fish should be consumed carefully.
findings.child_sweetener: {{keyword}} detected. Artificial sweetener intake should be monitored.
findings.teen_energy_drink: {{keyword}} detected. Energy drinks should be limited for teenagers.
findings.teen_alcohol: {{keyword}} detected. Alcohol is not suitable for under 18.
findings.teen_caffeine: {{keyword}} detected. Excessive caffeine consumption should be avoided.
findings.elderly_sodium: {{keyword}} detected. Salt intake should be monitored for blood pressure.
findings.elderly_raw: {{keyword}} detected. Raw foods may pose immune system risks.
findings.elderly_unpasteurized: {{keyword}} detected. Unpasteurized products may pose risks.
findings.pregnant_alcohol: {{keyword}} detected. Alcohol must be completely avoided during pregnancy.
findings.pregnant_raw_fish: {{keyword}} detected. Raw fish poses listeria and parasite risks during pregnancy.
findings.pregnant_raw_egg: {{keyword}} detected. Raw eggs pose salmonella risk during pregnancy.
findings.pregnant_unpasteurized: {{keyword}} detected. Unpasteurized products pose risks during pregnancy.
findings.pregnant_soft_cheese: {{keyword}} detected. Soft cheeses may pose listeria risk.
findings.pregnant_mercury: {{keyword}} detected. High-mercury fish should be avoided during pregnancy.
findings.pregnant_tuna: {{keyword}} detected. Tuna should be limited to 1-2 servings per week.
findings.pregnant_caffeine: {{keyword}} detected. Caffeine should be limited to 200mg daily during pregnancy.
findings.pregnant_liver: {{keyword}} detected. Liver is high in vitamin A, should be limited during pregnancy.
findings.pregnant_deli: {{keyword}} detected. Deli meats should not be consumed without thorough heating.
findings.breastfeeding_alcohol: {{keyword}} detected. Alcohol should be limited while breastfeeding.
findings.breastfeeding_caffeine: {{keyword}} detected. Caffeine may affect the baby while breastfeeding.
findings.breastfeeding_mercury: {{keyword}} detected. High-mercury fish should be limited while breastfeeding.

nutriscore.what_is_desc: Nutri-Score is an independent labeling system that classifies foods from A (healthiest) to E (least healthy). It is calculated based on calories, sugar, saturated fat, and salt content.

desc.a: High nutritional quality. Good for regular consumption.
desc.c: Average nutritional quality. Consume in moderation.
desc.unknown: Data is missing to calculate Nutri-Score for this product.

disclaimer.title: LEGAL DISCLAIMER
disclaimer.text: This analysis is generated by AI and does not constitute medical advice. Results are based on general database matches and are not guaranteed to be accurate. If you have allergen risks, please check the product label and consult your doctor.

scan.rotationLockHint: Not rotating? Disable rotation lock in phone settings
scan.frameSubtitlePortrait: Hold phone horizontally for long ingredient lists
scan.frameSubtitleLandscape: Position the ingredient list within the scan area
scan.textTooShort: Please enter sufficient content for analysis.
scan.notFoundDesc: This product is not in our database, but don't worry! You can scan the ingredients directly with the camera.
scan.invalidScanDesc: No readable food ingredients detected or this is not a food product.

errors.generic: An error occurred, please try again.
errors.barcodeProcessing: An error occurred while processing the barcode.
errors.imageLoad: An error occurred while loading the image.

limits.limit_reached_desc: Some of your weekly free usage limits have been reached. Switch to Premium for unlimited access.
limits.family_limit_desc: You can add a maximum of 1 family member in the free plan. Switch to Premium for unlimited profiles.
limits.renewal_desc: If you don't switch to Premium, your new limits will be available on {{date}}.
